Description: Mould-made pottery lantern with a cylindrical body with a domed top above a moulding, surmounted by a pierced lug. On each side is a flaming torch, and on the front is a shrine containing a bust of Athena in high relief, wearing a chiton and crested helmet. At the back is a rectangular opening, with a short groove on each side of the bottom edge, and a deep groove across the back parallel to the top edge. The concave base has an incised mark underneath. Traces of pink paint remain.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q611)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
